q: Wednesday that he felt he had to leave Number 10. Senior civil servants were told the following day. Mr David Cameron said he was "obviously very sorry to see him go". He said: He did a very good job as Director of Communications both for the Government and the country. He ran the Downing Street press office in a very professional and straightforward and correct way, and I think he's done some very good work. "But I understand why he wants to go with the things that happened with the News of the World... Obviously he resigned at the time and I've always felt he was punished for the same offence twice. Labour leader Ed Miliband said Mr Andy Coulson had "done the right thing" but should have gone earlier. Sergio Marchionne has talked of paying the governments back by the end of the year. "I'd like to pay them off in 2011, if I could," Sergio Marchionne told reporters earlier this month. I would like to get it done as quickly as I could. To be sure, the future is not all roses for the company- Magliano notes that while Chrysler's financial position has improved, the progress "hasn't really show up in sales."
